intro: Coprosma granadensis, commonly known as the Granada coprosma, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its small, white to pinkish flowers appear in clusters and are followed by bright red berries. Coprosma granadensis is often found in coastal and lowland forest habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
